net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base

Class AbstractDatatypeDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base.AbstractDatatypeDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatatypeDetector
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatatypeDetectorImpl

    public abstract class AbstractDatatypeDetector
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements DatatypeDetector
    This is the abstract base implementation of DatatypeDetector.
    Since:
    4.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • registerCustomDatatype

        protected void registerCustomDatatype(Class<?> datatype)
        This method registers a custom Datatype so it is recognized by isDatatype(Class).
        NOTE:
        There is no need in registering Enum datatypes as they are detected as such automatically.
        Parameters:
        datatype - is the Datatype to register.

      • registerCustomDatatype

        protected void registerCustomDatatype(String fullQualifiedDatatypeName)
        Like registerCustomDatatype(Class) but via fully qualified name. Can be used to prevent compile-time dependencies on datatype.
        Parameters:
        fullQualifiedDatatypeName - is the fully qualified name of the Datatype to register.
        See Also:
        registerCustomDatatype(Class)

      • registerStandardDatatype

        protected void registerStandardDatatype(Class<?> datatype)
        This method registers a Java standard Datatype so it is recognized by isJavaStandardDatatype(Class).
        Parameters:
        datatype - is the Datatype to register.

      • registerStandardDatatype

        protected void registerStandardDatatype(String fullQualifiedDatatypeName)
        Like registerStandardDatatype(Class) but via fully qualified name. Can be used to prevent compile-time dependencies on datatype.
        Parameters:
        fullQualifiedDatatypeName - is the fully qualified name of the Datatype to register.
        See Also:
        registerStandardDatatype(Class)

      • registerDefaultDatatypes

        protected void registerDefaultDatatypes()
        Registers the default datatypes.

      • registerNumberDatatypes

        protected void registerNumberDatatypes()
        Called from registerDefaultDatatypes() to add Number based datatypes. Can also be called standalone or overridden for customization.

      • registerJavaUtilDateCalendarDatatypes

        protected void registerJavaUtilDateCalendarDatatypes()
        Called from registerDefaultDatatypes() to add legacy Date and Calendar datatypes. Can also be called standalone or overridden for customization.

      • registerJavaTimeDatatypes

        protected void registerJavaTimeDatatypes()
        Called from registerDefaultDatatypes() to add JSR310 datatypes. Can also be called standalone or overridden for customization.

      • isDatatype

        public boolean isDatatype(Class<?> type)
        This method determines if the given Class reflects an (immutable) Datatype . It will return true if the given value is a String, Boolean, Character, anything derived from Number, an Enum, an instance of Datatype, a Date (even though not immutable) or anything similar.
        Specified by:
        isDatatype in interface DatatypeDetector
        Parameters:
        type - is the Class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given Class represents a Datatype, false otherwise.

      • isJavaStandardDatatype

        public boolean isJavaStandardDatatype(Class<?> type)
        This method determines if the given Class reflects a Java standard Datatype provided by the JDK. This is any primitive type or any of Integer, Long, Double, Float, Byte, Short, Boolean, String, Character, BigInteger, BigDecimal, Date, Calendar, LocalDate, LocalTime, LocalDateTime, Instant, OffsetDateTime, OffsetTime, Duration, ZonedDateTime, YearMonth, MonthDay, Year, Period, ZoneOffset.
        Specified by:
        isJavaStandardDatatype in interface DatatypeDetector
        Parameters:
        type - is the Class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given Class represents a Java standard Datatype, false otherwise.

      • setExtraDatatypes

        public void setExtraDatatypes(List<String> datatypeList)
        Adds a list of additional datatypes to register. E.g. for easy spring configuration and custom extension.
        Parameters:
        datatypeList - is the List of fully qualified names of additional Datatypes to register.
